column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and knowledgeable Arts Research Manager to join our team at   Rooftop, India s leading online learning platform for live art workshops and curated art courses.   As an Arts Research Manager, you will play a crucial role in supporting our mission to redefine people s   perception of art and build a unique art community. You will be responsible for conducting in-depth   research on various art forms, artists, art movements, and cultural heritage to enhance our course   offerings and ensure the highest quality educational experiences for our members. The ideal candidate   will have a strong passion for the arts, excellent research skills, and a keen eye for identifying emerging   trends and opportunities in the art industry.       Responsibilities:       Conduct comprehensive research on art forms, artists, art movements, and cultural heritage to   identify relevant topics for our art courses and workshops.   Stay updated with current trends, developments, and innovations in the art industry, both locally   and globally.   Collaborate with the content development team to create engaging and informative course   materials, including lesson plans, presentations, and supplemental resources.   Provide guidance and support to instructors and artists in developing course content that aligns   with our vision and meets the needs of our diverse audience.   Develop and maintain relationships with art institutions, galleries, and experts to stay connected   with the art community and foster potential collaborations.   Analyze participant feedback and performance data to continuously improve the quality and   effectiveness of our art experiences.   Assist in the curation and organization of art exhibitions, events, and workshops to showcase the   work of our artists and engage with the art community.   Collaborate with the marketing team to contribute art-related content for promotional materials,   blog posts, and social media platforms.   Stay updated on funding opportunities, grants, and scholarships in the art field and provide   support in securing funding for special projects or initiatives.       Requirements:       Master s degree in Art History, Fine Arts, Cultural Studies, or a related field.   Proven experience in arts research, preferably in the field of art education, art history, or cultural   studies.   Strong knowledge of various art forms, artists, art movements, and cultural heritage, with a focus   on Indian art and traditions.   Excellent research and analytical skills, with the ability to gather, evaluate, and synthesize   information from various sources.   Familiarity with digital research tools, databases, and academic resources related to the art field.   Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present research findings   clearly and engagingly.   Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to multitask and meet   deadlines.   Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and build relationships with artists,   instructors, and external stakeholders.   Passion for art and a deep understanding of its transformative power in society.   Flexibility and adaptability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.   Join us at Rooftop and contribute to our mission of making art accessible to all. Together, we can   shape a vibrant and inclusive art community that celebrates creativity and cultural heritage.
column11: Analytical skills, PDF, Social media, Project management, Focus, Research, Content development, Fine arts

column2: Manager (Research - Energy Markets) About Argus Argus is the leading independent provider of market intelligence to the global energy and commodity markets. We offer essential price assessments, news, analytics, consulting services, data science tools and industry conferences to illuminate complex and opaque commodity markets. Headquartered in London with over 1,300 staff, Argus is an independent media organisation with 29 offices in the worlds principal commodity trading hubs.  Companies, trading firms and governments in 160 countries around the world trust Argus data to make decisions, analyse situations, manage risk, facilitate trading and for long-term planning. Argus prices are used as trusted benchmarks around the world for pricing transportation, commodities and energy.  Founded in 1970, Argus remains a privately held UK-registered company owned by employee shareholders and global growth equity firm General Atlantic.  Argus Media is committed to ensuring career and personal growth for all its staff and provides extensive training and career development opportunities, as well as participation in employee-led initiatives, including a women?? network.  Our core values are Excellence, Integrity, Partnership and Inclusivity. What will you be doing?   Argus is a leading provider of insights, price indexes and consulting to the global energy industry. Companies in 140 countries as well as multilaterals like the International Energy Agency (IEA) use Argus data to index physical trade and as benchmarks in financial derivative markets as well as for analysis and planning purposes. We also have a burgeoning commodities markets consulting division that offers clients insights into the evolving markets and the opportunities that these changes present. This division uses industry best practices, expert knowledge and Argus??proprietary data to provide its clients with in-depth market analysis, the development of business strategies, evaluation of capital projects and advise on operations across a wide range of commodities and geographies. The division counts the biggest names in energy, petrochemicals, fertilizers and metals as well as governments as its clients. Given that our consulting business has been growing significantly over the last few years and we are currently looking for a Consulting Manager to join our consulting research team in Mumbai that would focus on a wide range of commodities in the energy sector including transition fuel, petrochemicals, biofuels, generation fuels, etc. The specifics of the job are laid out below. Key Responsibilities Assume responsibility of developing multi-client products and analytics with the help of Analysts and Senior Analysts. Develop and maintain in-house consulting tools and databases in support of consulting projects.  Assist in develop Argus??long term market view of key industries. Assist in the development of marketing materials for Argus??research products. Develop presentation materials and if required, deliver presentations on public conferences. Develop and train Analysts in their product knowledge and research skills. What we??e looking for in you: Excellent research skills. Able to develop methodologies and carry out market research projects. Good project management skill, ability to lead a team of analysts on research projects. Familiarity or experience in energy, commodities or petrochemicals markets would be a plus. Experience with working with teams and drawing upon resources across the organization. Candidates with at least six years??experience in related industries would be required. Growth Opportunities: Acquire an in-depth understanding of the inter-connectivity of a wide range of energy commodities to the general energy market. Develop deep capabilities in research, analysis and project management skills. Develop internal and external reputation as the subject matter expert in key industries. Good career path within Argus??consulting practice.  What?? in it for you: Competitive salary and company bonus scheme Flexible Working Model Group healthcare scheme 18 days annual leave 8 days casual leave Extensive internal and external training Hours This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are generally Monday through Friday; 09:00-18:00 with 1 hour for lunch. For more details about the company and to apply please make sure you send your CV and cover letter via our website: www.argusmedia.com/en/careers/open-positions   By submitting your job application, you automatically acknowledge and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data to the Company. Argus is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

column2: Roles & Responsibilities:  ??Analyze consumer needs, segments, profiles, buying behavior, and emerging trends to inform strategic  decision-making.   Determine market potential and trends, providing insights to guide business planning and growth  strategies.   Assess brand positioning and potential, evaluating opportunities for differentiation and market  expansion.   Evaluate new communication concepts to ensure alignment with brand objectives and resonate with  target audiences.   Conduct price assessments of new products, considering market demand, competitor pricing, and value  proposition.   Assess distribution and trade performance, identifying opportunities to optimize channel strategies and  enhance market reach.  Monitor brand performance metrics including profile, portfolio, equity, usage, and service satisfaction,  providing actionable insights for improvement.  Requirements and Skills:   Post-graduation in management / MBA is mandotary.   8 to 10 years experience in market research agencies like Kantar or market research team in an automobile, consumer durable, luxury products company.  2 years out of the total experience in any  company side is preferred.   Proficiency in analyzing data using tools like SPSS, SAS, and other research analysis software to  extract meaningful insights.   Experience in conducting primary (quantitative and qualitative) and secondary market research studies  to gather relevant consumer and market data.   Ability to design effective questionnaires and develop robust analysis methods to capture consumer  insights accurately.   Previous experience working with boutique market research agencies, demonstrating strong  collaboration and project management skills.

column2: Job Description: This is a manager level position in the Research??team within the ??arketing??function. The purpose is to support sales, practice, delivery and marketing by working on areas like market intelligence, account intelligence, client intel, competitors analysis, tracking & monitoring of key data sets, persona based analysis, org charts, social & professional media, ABM initiatives, industry trends, custom research reports, marketing automation tools and other defined research assignments. Responsibilities: Manage stakeholders, increase promoters and balance demand for Market Intelligence services withing business units, LOBs and groups Proactive & on-demand research, analysis across industries and technologies in the US market Interacting with stakeholders on regular basis, understanding their requirements and transforming into research framework and providing solutions  Shape research projects and develop execution plans, allocation of assignments, draft reviews and deliver actionable insights to stakeholders Support ABM initiatives, events, conferences, trade shows- & provide required assistance Develop strong relationships with stakeholders and drive collaboration within internal departments & groups to achieve research objectives Critically examine and deep dive into research models & types - Ideate, create, enhance, innovate, improve, maintain & execute campaigns Identify research process improvements or develop new processes, tools and build research specialization within strategic growth areas / accounts / industries / verticals Team Management - Train, mentor and develop team members & responsible for their growth Maintain internal knowledge base, CRM, repositories, resources & PM tools Functional reporting & dashboards on weekly basis ??create, maintain and innovate as & when necessary This position will provide the BUs, sales, pre-sales & practice with research and market intelligence services, primarily in the following categories:  Provide end-to-end research support to various groups & sales teams Proactive gathering, analysing, and communication of market data, trends and intelligence related to target accounts, industries and technologies Prepare and maintain materials, artefacts, documentation & reports for them Assist with sales enablement activities for client engagements & customer visits

column2: Exciting Opportunity for International Research Project Manager at GfK-NIQ! Are you passionate about managing international research projects and driving excellence in global operations? Join our dynamic team at GfK, a global leader in market research and data analytics, and be part of groundbreaking projects that shape industries worldwide! Role Summary: As an International Research Project Manager, you'll lead the management of international projects with external suppliers and internal operations departments. Your role is pivotal in ensuring that projects are executed efficiently, meeting budget, time, and quality standards. You'll provide expert consultation on best practices in international research.  Roles and Responsibilities: Review research proposals and collaborate with operations teams to develop operational plans and cost estimates. Source cost-effective and high-quality field services globally for international studies. Manage translation work to align with quality standards and budgets. Lead project kickoff meetings, ensuring clarity on timelines, responsibilities, and specifications. Facilitate communication and issue resolution with overseas suppliers. Coordinate project operations, including translations, programming, fieldwork, data delivery, and more. Provide technical and operational expertise to enhance international operations processes. Collaborate with teams to address issues and improve performance on research studies. Maintain accurate project documentation and contribute to team and organizational goals. Why Join Us? Work on cutting-edge international research projects with global impact. Collaborate with a diverse and talented team of experts. Continuous learning and development opportunities. Competitive compensation package and benefits. If you're ready to take your career to new heights and make a meaningful impact in the world of international research, apply now and be part of our journey at GfK!

column2: Ensures development of a successful project / workstream plan after high level direction from the senior project lead with a clear understanding of project objectives Takes ownership of methodology instrument design for market research projects to address key objectives based on high level guidance provided by senior project team member Translates understanding of brand strategy and client needs & beliefs into likely hypotheses, and ensures analytical approach is effective in testing hypotheses to find most relevant insights Anticipates potential challenges in analysis and proactively works with team to figure out a mitigation strategy Demonstrates creative flexibility and innovation to modify design approach as necessary with more abstract client feedback or changing business project objectives Is able to use the prior experience to apply advanced statistical knowledge (CHAID, Choice modeling, Clustering, kNN, Regression etc.) to solve a business problem Ensures that team members are able to execute the analysis with right analytical approach and proper quality check guidelines Proactively creates good processes and automation set ups to increase the efficiency and quality of the deliverables Responsible for quality of entire team and all materials; double-checks all project materials and analysis provided from other team members Maintains focus on strategic implications of analytical insights, and effectively guides junior team member(s) to achieve necessary depth and breadth of insights Ensure client needs and preferences are incorporated into slide development; customizes report to audience and format of presentation when developing deliverables Guides development of new slide frameworks and visual templates that can present key data / insights powerfully Sends timely and thoughtful responses to client/leadership requests, questions, and needs Presents project findings & recommendations to clients in a compelling and engaging way (when appropriate based on client presentation preferences) Responsible for professional development, engagement and coaching of junior team members Teaches best practices to junior team members for structured written and verbal communication Demonstrates a desire and willingness to learn, and learns for all interactions and team members on a project/team Adapts working style as needed, developing strong collaboration and trust across team members Demonstrates good judgement across all interactions, and a respect for all team members internally and externally Position Requirements Education:  A bachelor or masters degree in a quantitative, analytical discipline, such as Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Management Science, Data Science, Statistics, or Engineering will be preferred   Consultants  -  Minimum 3-5 years/   Manager- 5-8 years  of experience in Market Research and marketing consulting work. Knowledge of US healthcare market will be a plus Experience in execution of advanced analytical methods CHAID, Hypothesis Testing, A/B testing, CART, Regression, Clustering, Factor Analysis, MNL, Choice Modeling, kNN, K-means, Predictive analysis, Generalized Linear Models etc. Knowledge of tools/programming platforms  Sawtooth, R, SAS, SPSS, Advanced Excel, Advanced Powerpoint Experience in writing surveys and discussion guides with knowledge of biases and ways to make instruments easier for respondents Evidence of leading and managing teams/projects Evidence of strong oral and written communication Evidence of working in a fast-paced versatile environment Comfort and flexibility with ambiguity Strong attention to detail with a quality focused mindset Evidence for high motivation and good professional attitude/work ethic

column2: Job Description Title:Sales Excellence Competitive & Market Intelligence Associate Manager Role (Job Profile):Competitive & Market Intelligence Associate Manager Management Level:Associate Manager (ML8) You are: You are a natural-born competitor, and you love to win. You are eager to help your team develop the right strategy to come out on top. You have expert knowledge of the playing field and the competition's strengths and weaknesses, and you coach our players on how to defend our position and outscore the other teams. When the pressure is high, you rally the team to be fearless and work together to achieve success. You see every victory and loss as an opportunity to refine the strategy and compete better next time. The work: You will be a trusted advisor for Accenture leaders and deal teams. You'll provide them with critical insights about Accenture's clients, markets, services and competition. With these insights, you enable them to improve our competitive positioning on deals and drive sales decisions. You play a key role in maximizing profitability for Accenture. You will: Analyze market and competitive trends across key themes Deliver actionable insights to differentiate and optimize deals Build specialization within strategic growth areas at Accenture Develop best practices and contribute to cross-team initiatives to promote team productivity Develop strong relationships with stakeholders and drive collaboration Mentor and develop team members Conduct research across best-in-class resources and platformsHere's what you need: Master's degree or comparable coursework/experience English language fluency (oral and written) A minimum of 4 or more years of experience doing similar workExtra credit if you have:  Qualification Business management education Familiarity with Accenture sales processes and tools and/or understanding of sales processes and tools Experience working across global teams in a sales enablement, advisory or strategy function Relevant experience in strategy, consulting, research, or technologyYou may also need: A home office or work area that is suitable for productive work, per local guidelines. This includes a safe, ergonomic workspace and a high-speed internet connection that is stable and secure.
column11: business analysis, sales, market analysis, marketing, market intelligence, business research, business development, market research, competitive intelligence, strategic planning, brand management, primary research, secondary research, key account management

column2: Job Title: Business Marketing Manager (Part-Time, Remote) Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Business Marketing Manager to join our team on a part-time, remote basis. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in marketing, exceptional strategic thinking abilities, and a proven track record in developing and executing marketing campaigns that drive business growth. This role requires excellent communication skills, creativity, and the ability to work independently in a remote environment.   Key Responsibilities: Develop and Implement Marketing Strategies:  Create comprehensive marketing plans that align with business goals, target customer segments, and market trends. Campaign Management:  Plan, execute, and manage multi-channel marketing campaigns, including digital marketing, content marketing, email marketing, social media, and SEO/SEM. Market Research:  Conduct thorough market research to identify new opportunities, understand customer needs, and stay ahead of industry trends. Brand Management:  Enhance brand awareness and ensure consistent messaging across all marketing channels. Content Creation:  Oversee the creation of engaging and relevant content, including blog posts, newsletters, social media updates, and promotional materials. Performance Analysis:  Monitor and analyze the performance of marketing initiatives using various analytics tools, providing regular reports and insights to guide strategy adjustments. Budget Management:  Manage the marketing budget effectively, ensuring optimal use of resources to achieve marketing objectives. Collaboration:  Work closely with sales, product development, and other internal teams to ensure alignment and support business goals. Customer Engagement:  Develop and maintain relationships with customers, partners, and stakeholders to foster engagement and loyalty. Innovation:  Stay updated with the latest marketing technologies and methodologies, implementing innovative strategies to enhance marketing effectiveness.   Required Skills and Qualifications: Education:  Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus. Experience:  At least 5 years of experience in a marketing role, preferably in a business-to-business (B2B) environment. Digital Marketing Expertise:  Strong knowledge of digital marketing channels, tools, and best practices. Analytical Skills:  Proficiency in using analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, HubSpot) to measure and optimize marketing performance. Project Management:  Excellent project management skills, with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously. Communication Skills:  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail. Self-motivation:  Highly self-motivated and capable of working independently in a remote setting. Technical Skills:  Proficiency in using marketing software (e.g., CRM, email marketing platforms) and Microsoft Office Suite.   Work Schedule and Environment: Part-Time: W ith flexible scheduling options. Remote:  This is a fully remote position, allowing you to work from anywhere. Occasional virtual meetings will be required.   How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit their resume, a cover letter detailing their relevant experience, and any portfolio samples demonstrating their previous marketing work.
column11: Strategic Marketing Planning, Digital Marketing, Social Media Marketing, Marketing Communication, Brand Strategy, Content Strategy, Competitor Analysis, Team Skills, Marketing Budget, Management Skills, Marketing Experience, Market Research And Analysis, Marketing Planning

column2: Overview This role will lead an R&D GBS Technical Market Analysis team out of Hyderabad and be responsible for coordinating and managing scientific, competitive, market, and desk research activities, consumer testing, and new idea feasibility analysis. This role will support the overall Technical Market Analysis capability and serve as a central access point to in-market R&D teams for the provision of accurate and relevant research outputs. Responsibilities Functional Responsibilities Act as a POC (point of contact) for R&D market analysis delivery to in-market R&D teams Engage with in-market R&D leads in scoping the initial problem and defining key questions to frameup the research Participate in required GBS governance meetings and provide reports on KPIs and SLAs as needed Ensure all requests are processed, documented, and delivered within defined SLAs Assign the appropriate resources for each project  CPG/FMCG/ Food and Beverage/Health and Nutrition/Life Science industry knowledge with systems level thinking and ability to cross reference other industry insights to shape the content that research team puts together  Visionary leader with an intent of digitizing and automating research in the future  Support in the execution and evolution of playbooks for Technical Market Analysis as needed Lead team in the development of competitor assessments and benchmarking industry profiles and projects including industry trends, challenges, key players, IP, and value chain key points Report to Technical Market Analysis Capability Lead when required Foster and leverage working relationships with other GBS Technical Market Analysis teams in Hyderabad, and other GBS R&D Capabilities, when required Train, mentor, and manage GBS teams of Senior Analysts and Analysts  Manage team workload and provide subject matter or market-specific expertise to support in daily execution of (high complexity) research activities when necessary; conduct project deliverable reviews to identify and correct gaps in the research or expected outcomes, actionable insights and recommendations for the stakeholders Ability to multi-task and manage overall 2-3 research requests simultaneously for the stakeholders Oversee and manage scientific, market, and consumer secondary research and analysis synthesis in line with global requests and ad hoc inquiries as required; ability to connect the dots across different requests and previous workstreams.  Develop action plans and organize career path meetings to drive team motivation and increase retention rates Identify potential areas for process improvements and employee upskilling to make recommendations to R&D GBS Leadership for continuous capability development Prior experience of working in a global shared services environment preferred Proven supervisory and workstream management skills working with parallel teams or functional leads in different time zones and locations Experience building a high performing and highly engaged team to stand up a R&D capability Qualifications Strong understanding of Service Management processes especially business research/ technology-IP intelligence, strategic intelligence for CPG/ FMCG/ Food and Beverage/Health and Nutrition/Life Science industry, detail oriented and self-motivated Decode the business problem and align with the expected outcomes to answer the key questions for stakeholder with advanced analytical research skills to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions Ability to supervise and manage time effectively across multiple priorities and projects requiring a high degree of organizational and communication skills to ensure requests are delivered in a timely manner, Experience working in a large global CPG company, with understanding of the CPG performance outputs and measures Custom market research experience with specific knowledge of relevant subject matter literature resources a plus (technical, patent, food, beverage, ingredient, packaging, equipment, pharma preferably consumer healthcare, health or wellness sciences)  Knowledge of market research and analysis tools such as Statista, Mintel, Factiva, Euromonitor, Knovel, MarketLine, Crunchbase, PubMed, Science Direct, Orbit, and others Experience of handling min. team of 3-4 individuals or have 3-4 Direct Reportees Fluent in English Bachelors degree required (Chemical Engineering, Food Technology, Pharma or any other science field; Masters degree a plus (MBA, MLS, MLIS or any other science field) Efficient oral and written communication 7-9 years of prior work experience in similar or related field
column11: Service Management, business research, Orbit, Statista, research analysis, Mintel, Factiva, Euromonitor, Knovel, PubMed, Science Direct, MarketLine, Crunchbase
